Hi,

We have important information on the confluence and that page has been restricted be a particular group.
My requirement is that when someone is added to that group, then a notification will be send to the administrator of that group(you have to declare the admin of that group while creating the group; if you not mention admin then no notification should be send on addition of user).   Just a notification mail, not an approval mail...

It will notify/ inform that person/admin that particular user has been given access to this page.
It's a  most critical issue in your organization..

Please look into the issue..

Thanks and Regards,
- Vishal
fields.summary: Notification must be send on addition of user to a group...

fields.description: {panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa} *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-9104]. {panel} Would like to make it more convenient for tiny links to be used. Tiny links have the advantage of being more stable for linking to confluence pages from other places (like JIRA). Confluence does a pretty good job of re-directing old page names to new page names, but it is still adds extra steps to follow the links. The nice thing about tiny links is that they survive refactoring of page names. An example is using Confluence for program documentation and including links in JIRA issues and source code. In particular, the smaller link is more convenient. I have customized .../pages/page-breadcrumbs.vm to include a small icon representing the tiny link. Something like this would make the tiny link directly accessable without going to the INFO tab page. {noformat} #if (!$viewpagebreadcrumb) ... ## Customize - put an easy to access tiny link on the page as icon following page name in breadcrumb line #if ($tinyUrl) #end #end {noformat}
fields.summary: Make tiny link more accessible (perhaps with link on breadcrumb)

fields.description:
There is no clean way of overriding existing xwork actions through the plugin infrastructure. 

The recommended solution (discussed in  [this thread|http://forums.atlassian.com/thread.jspa?messageID=257242661]) is reproducing the {{pages}} package in the {{atlassian-plugin.xml}}, or making the change directly in {{xwork.xml}}.

The solutions is not appropriate for plugins because:
* copy-pasting the {{pages}} packages from {{xwork.xml}} would require having a version of the plugin for each version of confluence that has changes on {{xwork.xml}}
* Replacing the class in {{xwork.xml}} would not work either, because it is read upon startup, +before+ the plugins are loaded, thus the loader does not find the new class (lots of exceptions thrown)
fields.summary: Ability for plugins to override existing xwork actions

fields.description:
It would be informative to have a Page Activity panel on the Page Info tab displaying a trend of the number of page views and edits over the last 12 months.

The line graph should show:
- Anonymous Views
- User Views
- Total Views
- Edits

It should also show actual values periodically.

fields.description:
It would be very informative to have a Page View counter in the page info tab. This should be broken down into registered users and anonymous views, eg

Monthly Views:      35
   Anonymous Users:    30
   Registered Users:     5

If anonymous access is disabled, it should only display

Monthly Views:      35

It would be great if this could be added keeping in mind that users may wish to have a graphical page view and edit chart chart in future.

Steps to show unintuitive behavior:

# Click insert/edit image button
# Define file name
# Check thumbnail
# Change alignment to centre
# Click browse next to attach file and choose an image file
# Forget to click attach

fields.description:
Debated calling this a feature or bug, but I think it is really a bug. Many pages are defined by their attachments, more than the page content. However, when a page's attachments are updated, it does not show on the recently-updated macros or trigger a watch. This makes it difficult for people to monitor for new attachments and therefore effectively hides information. I really think this is a significant problem.

At the very least, you should be able to specify to include attachment changes in recently-updated and watch on the attachments portion of a page (and probably RSS, too) - though I think the simpler solution would just be to bump up the updated date on the page when the attachments are added.
fields.summary: adding/modifying attachments do not result in a page change

fields.description: When using the attachments macro, there is no sort order option documented. In addition, the default sort order (by creator?) doesn't make a lot of sense. Date or title would be a more reasonable default, and it should be able to be overridden in the macro so that content is easier to find.
fields.summary: no sort order option on attachments macro

fields.description: The top-users macro includes the timespan and period parameters, as with all activity macros. However, the documentation does not make it clear what they actually do. It appears that timespan is useful for limiting the scope of the statistics, and that period has no function at all. Think that the descriptions for these two items were just copied from other activity macros where their exact function was more obvious from context.
fields.summary: top-users parameters confusing

fields.description: The top-users and other related activity macros do not support a limit on the number of results returned. By default, 10 is returned, which is kind of annoying. A parameter to restrict this would be extremely useful.
fields.summary: activity lists return too many results

fields.description:
Error clicking the 'Back' button to return to search results page.

The following sequence results in an error
1. Execute a search 
2. Select a page from search results
3. Click 'Back' button to return to search results
4. Error on page states 'Warning: Page has expired'

I think this is a significant flaw in that most users are familiar with google and yahoo searches where re executing the search is not necessary.  I listed it as a minor issue since there is a work around but it does impact the perception of the product and can hurt adoption rates on the enterprise level.
fields.summary: Error when clicking 'Back' to return to search results

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-9081].
  {panel}

I sometimes find the ordering of search results a little difficult to use. In particular, results which have phrases or have matches closer together are not put high enough.

An example:
On our wiki I was searching for *jira time tracker*; there are 2 pages that have details about this little app that we've built. The one I was looking for was on page 3 of the search (see searchResults1.png). If I search with quotes *"jira time tracker"* then I only get the 2 pages back (see searchResults2.png).

It would be better to prioritise this ranking of pages with phrases or matching words closer together.
fields.summary: Improve search result ordering , giving prioity to pages that have the all the search works found closer together or as a phrase

The steps are explained in the following:

# Create a page consisting of Chinese characters
# Upload image files (eg. 我哈.jpg) with Chinese characters 
# Display the image, \!我哈.jpg!, within the page  
# Export the space to HTML 
# Unzip the file 
# Open up the page with Chinese characters (converted to pageid)  

Clearly, the image is not displayed

fields.description:
This is actually a change to Crowd documentation but is triggered by changes in Confluence.

----
For the forthcoming 2.5.x release and for 2.6, the documentation for integrating with Crowd needs some small changes.
I guess this change should also apply to 1.0 Crowd documentation.

In the descriptions below I'm referring to the documentation at -
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CROWD/3.2.3+Integrating+Crowd+with+Atlassian+Confluence

Step 1 in section 2.1 asks you to copy jar files to {{.../WEB-INF/lib}}.
An additional jar is required if you are using Confluence 2.6 or Confluence 2.5.6 or later.
This jar is called {{crowd-integration-bamboo-1.1.1.jar}} and is available from the link -
{{http://confluence.atlassian.com/download/attachments/198785/crowd-integration-bamboo-1.1.1.jar?version=1}}


Step 1 in section 2.2 asks you to uncomment a repository setting. This should be changed to document adding a new entry of -

{noformat}
<crowd key="crowd" name="Crowd Repository"/> 
{noformat}

Just to re-iterate, this change is only applicable for Confluence 2.6 and 2.5.6. For older versions the instructions are unchanged.

(This was introduced by {{http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/USER-165}} which now bundles atlassian-user-1.5 with Confluence 2.6 and Confluence 2.5.6.)
fields.summary: Changes to Crowd and Confluence integration instructions
{noformat} does not work when enclosed in {column}{section} (macros, headings are interpreted)

fields.description:
Site Admins should have access to all the content (read access as well as write access).

This rule is being broken in the case when a regular user restricts editing of a page only to him self (and optionally to other users).

In such a case the "edit" tab is not being rendered for site admins.

It seems that the problem is only in the code that renders the view, because the edit tab is accessible by manually creating the url i.e. http://mywiki.com/pages/editpage.action?pageId=23342

This should be easy to fix, so please fix it in the next release
fields.summary: Site Admins Don't Have Access to Restricted Pages

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-9065].
  {panel}

It is a policy of ours to keep our helpdesk (which had confluence admin rights so they can create spaces) from creating spaces that allow anonymous users to do anything more than view and create comments. So it would be very helpful if there were a way or hide or grey out the ability to do this in spaces/createspace-start.action without having to override the vm in confluence to do so. This could either be done through a properties file or via some new admin UI functionality.

In addition, it would be helpful to keep space admins and helpdesk (that are currently conf-admins so they can create spaces) from being able to change any anonymous permissions except view space and create comments. This would require a change to spaces/editspacepermissions.action?key=myspacekey

Currently we are already doing both of these things by overriding the confluence templates, but we'd rather be able to configure Confluence to do it instead.

Thanks!
fields.summary: Add ability to set whether those that can create spaces and those that can manage spaces can have to ability of giving anonymous certain rights

fields.description:
We would like to be able to have "Registered users - anyone logged into Confluence" unchecked under both "Choose who can view and comment on content:" and "Choose who can contribute (create and edit) content:" by default on spaces/createspace-start.action.

It would be really nice to either set a properties file that allows you to configure what these defaults would be, or to have a another level of admin configuration in confluence UI that lets you set the default values of these flags.

Our admins are accidentally creating spaces that anyone can edit, which is in the spirit of collaboration, but is against the policies here.
fields.summary: Add ability to configure default space permissions in spaces/createspace-start.action
Cannot hide variable names of form elements in template
Calendar form element in templates

fields.description:
The text for the key {code}com.atlassian.confluence.pages.action.ViewChangesSinceLastLoginAction.action.name{code} seems to be missing. Please see attached screenshot.

This is the case when someone has edited the page since you logged in and you click to view those changes from the Page Info tab.

Please add this key to ConfluenceActionSupport.properties file so that it can also be translated.
fields.summary: Missing text in breadcrumbs when viewing changes since last login

fields.description:
It isn't supposed to, but does. See attached screenshot.

Chris reckons it might be related to running on Mac OS X.
fields.summary: Cluster setup network interface selection shows loopback interface

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-9058].
  {panel}

Some users, particularly those running the standalone, are believing that the application is freezing after they run the startup script. A hint to visit the website address would help these users out. Confluence should attempt to retrieve the address from the server since even though proxies may change this then .

Example message 1 - 
The Confluence server has started successfully - visit http://localhost:8080 to begin using Confluence

If looking up the hostname and port from the application server is a problem (Jeff's attempted this) then you could just have startup.bat check if it's the first run and display a similar message on first run only.
fields.summary: Output instructions to visit http://hostname:port on successful startup

fields.description: Both "Add Label" fields on the "Add Label To Space" screen have the name "newSpaceLabel".  This causes a bug with error reporting.  When an error is reported the "newSpaceLabel" is not cleared, so when the screen is written out, both fields are populated with the value last entered.
fields.summary: Both "Add Label" fields populated when error occurs adding space label

fields.description:
The default 404 page shows a list of spaces.
On a big, busy instance this can  generate a lot of load.
The query is run on every 404 which can happen multiple times on a request if there are some bad resources (missing css/js etc).

Perhaps there should be some sort of throttling or configuration to control the affect of this.

fields.description:
With two clustered nodes fronted by load balanced with session affinity turned on (by IP), if you set a global logo as administrator the logo file does not get replicated onto both servers (was broken link on one server and viewable image on the other). This issue was seen on several different computers/browsers, so it is not a cache/loading issue in the browser.

The workaround was that we specified the server address specifically in the browser of the server not containing the logo and reset the global logo to the same logo. After this, both servers showed the global logo.

It would appear that all files are not getting replicated between the clustered servers which is a great concern.
fields.summary: In clustered environment, if you add global logo, logo image file is not distributed to every server

fields.description:
It would appear that the authenticator could be called twice at almost exactly the same time by 2 or more clustered servers.

It would seem as if when there are 2 load balanced confluence servers with session affinity based on IP that it should not throw an error if you have a single request come in to login and that login involves calling an authenticator to check to see if a user exists and if not then creating it. However, we are getting unique constraint errors when this occurs.

This has been logged within support issue CSP-10474. Attached code used to replicate the issue. Latest info on that plugin at: https://spaces.internet2.edu/display/SHIB/ShibbolizedConfluence

It is also noted that this issue could be caused (with that code) because there are two requests on the same server at the same time to create the user. I'm going to contact them about this and implement a workaround to ignore unique constraint exceptions in this code, but we have only seen this occur when we were clustering more than one server, and it has occurred twice in the last week with a very small (<10 user) userbase.
fields.summary: Authenticator (subclass of DefaultAuthenticator) can be called twice at almost exactly same time by 2 or more clustered servers

fields.description:
Re: CONF-8766, the Confluence feature that redirects users to pages that have been moved or had their name truncated in the URL may not work on servers that only support the Servlet 2.3 specification, such as Tomcat 5.0. It will work fine with any application server that fully supports the Servlet specification v2.4 or higher, or the J2EE specification v1.4 or higher.

Applications that (claim to) support Servlet 2.4 or J2EE 1.4 include:

* Websphere 6.1
* Weblogic 9
* Tomcat 5.5
* Resin 3.0

We should document this alongside any documentation of the feature itself, and possibly put a caveat in the system requirements stating that while Servlet 2.3 is a _supported_ platform, some functionality may be degraded in older application servers.
fields.summary: Document that redirect feature for not-found pages might not work in older appservers

fields.description:
I successfully performed a fresh install of 2.5.4 on WebSphere 5.1.1.15 and Oracle 10g. Using the wiki and other tips (my classloader needed to be PARENT_LAST instead of PARENT_FIRST), installation was straight forward and the end result looked good. Except for plugins. I quickly noticed that I had no Rich Text editor capability and it appeared that I was missing other plugins if I recalled correctly an earlier installation.

Since I hadn't really put much time into this I completely uninstalled everything and installed a slightly older version - 2.4.5. This installation also went well. And the result confirmed my suspicions: the Rich Text Editor was back as were a boatload of plugins.

Just to confirm my earlier issues I then went back and completely uninstalled 2.4.5 and reinstalled 2.5.4 and once again I was missing Rich Text editing and a bunch of plugins. Summarizing what appears to be missing from my 2.5.4 installation:

1) I am totally missing Rich Text editing.
2) It looks like I am missing a whole bunch of plugins.
3) I am missing the admin menu item called "Plugin Repository".

I saw a similar thread - http://forums.atlassian.com/thread.jspa?messageID=257247903&#257247903 - that seemed to address the same thing. But in that one, they discuss the bundled-plugins/ directory not including the atlassian-tinymce-plugin-1.12.jar file. That's not the case with me. My fresh 2.5.4 install DID include that jar file and 10 others. But I still don't have any Rich Text editing capability. And yes, the admin Feature Settings menu showed that RTE is turned on, even though it doesn't appear.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
After this, I just tried a fresh install of 2.5.5 and it has exactly the same problem as 2.5.4 described above.  Attached are some screenshots of my 2.5.5 install.
fields.summary: Rich Text Editor and other plugins not appearing . 2.5.4 and 2.5.5 when installed with WebSphere

The issue is not the database propagation but the awareness of the change (event?)

fields.description:
When I use jiraissues macro on my Jira server, I catch this exception :

Error rendering macro: java.io.IOException: Could not download: <url>

But the macro works with issues on this server for example (jira.atlassian.com). So it's not a proxy problem.

My JIRA instance allows remote API use and the URL works with a directly connection by browser. So URL exists and is reachable.

Tomcat runs on 8680, so maybe it's a problem for Confluence.

The used URL respects this template :

http://server.com:8680/jira/sr/jira.issueviews:searchrequest-xml/temp/SearchRequest.xml?os_username=foo&os_password=bar&pid=10000&sorter/field=issuekey&sorter/order=DESC&tempMax=1000 and works well with a browser.
fields.summary: jiraissues macro could not download on other port

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-9005].
  {panel}

Hello,

in our confluence installation we have many spaces. One of the big spaces has a fixed tree structure. On certain tree levels we have moderators that are responsible for their area (means for all the pages below a certain page -  descendants).
Due to the size of the area a moderator would like to see recently created and updated pages of his area. One of the options would be to use labels, but a lot of people do forget to label their pages and those pages should also be found and reviewed by the moderator.
We would like to have recently-updated macro supporting similar parameters like metadata-report macro: in particular root and pages options (http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFEXT/Metadata+Plugin#MetadataPlugin-Macrokeywords).

Up to now, recently-updated macro is only usable for small spaces with a few edits.

Thanks,
  Yuri


{panel:title=Atlassian Update - January 2019|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5|titleBGColor=#3C78B5|bgColor=#E7F4FA}


Hi all, 

Thanks for your interest in this issue. We appreciate that this request may bring many benefits to you. However, we're unable to implement all the suggestions.

We don't plan to work on this for the foreseeable future, but we will review this suggestion again in 12 months time and provide an update if the status changes. 


Confluence Server Product Management
{panel}
fields.summary: recently-updated macro to support confluence hierarchy
